results.title: The Eleven Powers
results.creator_credit: Frank Heimans, Larry Gartenstein and Cinetel Productions
results.brief_description: In 1979, the Festival of the Eleven Powers took place on the island of Bali. The festival is called into being every 100 years to mark the closing of the Balinese century and re-establish the balance of the positive and negative forces in the world. Over two million people took part in the sixty days of purification and religious fervour. Script by Bryce Courtenay and narrated by Orson Welles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Heimans, Larry Gartenstein and Cinetel Productions

results.title: The Elephant will never forget
results.brief_description: Trams in London are a thing of the past - buses have taken over. The film, completed in London’s “Last Tram Week”, takes you round the streets of South London and along the embankment with 2 cockneys who remember a song about trams that they sang in the music halls fifty years ago. Finally, 20,000 Londoners cheer and sing their goodbyes to the trams which for 91 years have rattled and clanged and swayed by.

results.title: The Elements of composition
results.creator_credit: Lee R. Bobker, Nina Collier and Dynamic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music for Young People”.
Defines and explains melody, harmony, rhythm and counterpoint to a young audience. Each element is illustrated by the New York Woodwind Quintet. The film emphasises that melody is full of character, the addition of harmony makes music complete, rhythm is of many kinds and can be felt and listening to counterpoint is like following a conversation. Summarises and contrasts the elements of composition through the playing of a harmonic, rhythmic and contrapuntal treatment of the melody. Script by Lydia Perera

results.title: The Electronic Office
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Electronic Office”.
A computer education program that consists of six parts, each 25 minutes long. The parts are: 1.”Office on the move”, 2.”The stand-alone micro”, 3. “Wiring up the organisation”, 4. “Changing with the times”, 5. “Wiring up the world”, 6.”Easy to use”.

results.title: The Electromagnetic spectrum
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Provides demonstrations of ultra-violet and infra-red radiation, radio waves and microwaves and shows the application of reflection of light in medical technology particularly X-ray machines, broadcasting and microwave ovens. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Electro-magnet
results.creator_credit: Harry Dance, Denis Ward and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: The principles and application of the electro-magnet, production of magnetic fields by simple experiments; effect of introducing iron cores; retention of magnetism by a steel core; use of electro-magnets in telephone receivers and telephone exchanges; a “self-starter” of a motor vehicle leads on to consideration of AC and DC motors.

results.title: The Elderly are all of us, only a little older
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at the rehousing of elderly people in units with all modern conveniences. Follows the building of the units and the settling in of its new occupants together with their feelings about the move.

results.title: The Effects of fire
results.brief_description: This proposed public imaging piece shows a series of close up portraits of domestic objects being burnt to abstraction, creating an inventory of domestic combustion in this piece. Punctuated with subtle yet deliberate, almost mechanised camera moves and cut in a very subdued fashion, this piece will be predominantly shot with a macro lens and will also be given a highly colour saturated visual treatment in post production.
